name: Avoid too many EJB bean
description: Reports a violation when the number of EJB beans (Session, Message Driven and Entity beans) defined in the application (ejb-jar.xml or annotation) is greater than 500. This number can be changed as will through the threashold parameter.
output:
This report a violation when the number of EJB is greater than 500 Or the threshold.
It provides the following information:
 - Application
 - Number of EJB
rationale:
When too many EJB beans are created, the application performance can be poor because most of the functionalities will be run through a session (which means that the EJB container intercepts and processes many more method calls). Also, the application server itself may not perform as well because of the additional resources required to deploy and pool instances for many sessions.
In addition, there is more development effort due to all the session-related artifacts.
remediation: Review the design of your application to decrease this number.
